other_tests.findings: Bibasilar atelectasis. Multiple bilateral pulmonary parenchymal abnormalities are nodular in nature, and similar compared to prior chest radiographs. Overall, no suggestion of acute infection. No pleural or pericardial effusion. Extensive colonic diverticulosis in the sigmoid colon, with a large diverticula in the area of the hepatic flexure, surrounded by stranding and colonic wall thickening. Normal findings in the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenals, kidneys, urinary bladder, and distal ureters.
